item.description:
What is a mouthOff -- storytellers that congregate and tell stories in unexpected places. 

MouthOffs are spoken word events where stories, for adults, and on a theme, are offered in an open mic format by a round robin of professional tellers as well as those "new to the art of story. "   They are held on street corners, orchards, parks and other nontraditional venues.

For the third summer,  mass mouth, inc. takes to the streets as part of its mission " to promote the art of storytelling in the 21st century."“Look for us, everywhere, “ said Andrea Lovett alluding to mass mouth, inc. plans to tell in unconventional venues; on buses, subways and greenways. “And listen for story everywhere, “ said Norah Dooley, “ Because storytelling is in every part of our lives”.

The July 17 mouthOff on the theme "fire," will be hosted by the uncanny actor and storyteller Alan White ( http://www.thealanwhite.com). ; Alan performs throughout New England and tells stories of ghastly deeds and high piracy along The Freedom Trail, Boston.  He tours his storytelling show, "Around the World in Folk and Fairy Tales."

Look for the massmouth banner in Columbus Park, The North End.  Free and (very) open to the public!

Questions?  email: stories@massmouth.com
